conclusion: Given information about the problem including conveyor belt speed, distance between wheels, object mass, gravitational acceleration, and coefficient of kinetic friction.
The object is placed on the conveyor directly above wheel M with zero velocity relative to the ground.
Determine the frictional force that accelerates the object until it reaches the speed of the belt.
Calculate the normal force as F_N = mg = 30 N.
Calculate the frictional force as F_f = μF_N = 9 N.
Friction acts in the direction of the belt's motion, accelerating the object to the belt's speed.
Calculate the work done by friction as W = F_f × L_1 = 90 J.
Verify the approach by confirming that friction does positive work, transferring energy to the object.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object is 90 Joules.
